message_1:
A company needs to transport a total of 1000 units of products from location A to location B. There are 3 available routes to choose from, each with different capacities as shown below:

Route 1: Capacity of 350 units
Route 2: Capacity of 450 units
Route 3: Capacity of 600 units

What is the minimum number of trips the company needs to make in order to transport all 1000 units of products?
message_2:
To minimize the number of trips, the company should use the routes with the highest capacities first. 

First, use Route 3 with a capacity of 600 units. After this trip, 400 units remain to be transported (1000 - 600 = 400).

Next, use Route 2 with a capacity of 450 units. This will be enough to transport the remaining 400 units.

So, the minimum number of trips the company needs to make is 2.
